author: Special Correspondent
text:
Three members of a family were found dead on Saturday in an apartment in South Kolkata’s Palm Avenue area.

“The dead have been identified as Jessica Fonseca, 42, and her two sons. Neil Fonseca, 49, husband of Jessica is in a hospital with serious injuries,” Debasish Boral, Special Additional Commissioner of Kolkata Police (Crime) said.

All three bodies were found in one room of the three-room apartment. Three kitchen knives with bloodstains and a 25-pound dumbbell were recovered from the crime scene.

While the deceased had cut marks on throat and injury with a heavy blunt object on the head, the injured Fonseca, an interior decorator, had cut marks on throat and hand.

Senior officers said the police have asked the doctors to ascertain whether Mr. Fonseca’s injuries are self inflicted or somebody attacked him.

According to Mr. Fonseca’s statement to the police, in the early hours of Saturday, Jessica started a fight with him. She stabbed the two children and attacked him. It was in a fit of anger that he attacked her with a dumbbell. “These statements are subject to investigation and confirmation,” Mr. Boral said. Preliminary investigation shows a family dispute could have led to the murder. Mr. Fonseca reportedly admitted that his affair with another woman was the reason for discord between him and his wife.

title: Three of a family found dead in Kolkata house
